New Records: The Yankees are the first team to have a game with a blown five-run lead, at least five unearned runs, three errors, a balk, and catcher's interference in the last 112 seasons.
Walker Buehler recorded his first career big-league save in a World Series-clinching game.
The Dodgers became the first team to win a World Series clincher after trailing by five runs.
Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole had a no-hitter watch that turned into a five-run inning for the Dodgers.
The Yankees committed three errors, a balk, and a catcher's interference.
Walker Buehler earned a save in the World Series-clinching game despite having zero career big-league saves before.
Blake Treinen pitched 42 pitches starting from the sixth inning to help secure the win.
The Dodgers scored five unearned runs in the fifth inning to tie the game.
The Dodgers took the lead for good in the eighth inning with a two-run rally, including a catcher's interference call.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Friedman emphasized the unpredictability and beauty of baseball.
Max Muncy reflected on the team's resilience throughout the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees became the first team to hit back-to-back homers in the first inning of a World Series game.
The Dodgers won the World Series clincher despite their starter not making it past the second inning.
